section.title: What is &carrot;?
section.para: &carrot; is an open source framework for search results clustering and other text-mining applications. The project was initially written by Dawid Weiss and Stanisław Osiński for academic purposes, but evolved into a production-quality software comparable to commercial products on the market.
A spin-off commercial company &carrotsearch; provides even more efficient and scalable search results clustering solutions based on (and smoothly integrated) with the open source code.

section.title: About this manual
section.para: This manual discusses the basic concepts behind internal &carrot; architecture. The project is mainly developer-based and as such no verbose documentation is written as it would always lag behind the codebase. If you have questions or concerns, it is best to contact the authors via the official project mailing list and ask directly.
